TopicTitle: Stock part drag for various configurations

Articles.Content:
The kerbal wiki gives drag coefficients for certain parts, but I'm not sure if I am interpreting them correctly. Is there a difference in these two configurations in terms of drag? (pointy end pointing forward in both examples)

  1. http://wiki.kerbalspaceprogram.com/wiki/Mk2_to_1.25m_Adapter_Long
  2. http://wiki.kerbalspaceprogram.com/wiki/Mk2_to_1.25m_Adapter + http://wiki.kerbalspaceprogram.com/wiki/Mk2_Rocket_Fuel_Fuselage_Short

How about this:

  1. http://wiki.kerbalspaceprogram.com/wiki/Mk2_Rocket_Fuel_Fuselage
  2. http://wiki.kerbalspaceprogram.com/wiki/Mk2_Rocket_Fuel_Fuselage_Short + http://wiki.kerbalspaceprogram.com/wiki/Mk2_Rocket_Fuel_Fuselage_Short
Edited September 22, 2016 by Suedocode
Those drag values are deprecated, they're from the old aero model. Now you need to look at drag cubes, most of which are stored in PartDatabase.cfg.

2 minutes ago, Red Iron Crown said:

Those drag values are deprecated, they're from the old aero model. Now you need to look at drag cubes, most of which are stored in PartDatabase.cfg.

Is there a place to view that online, or do I need to wait to go home and pick through the KSP directory to find it?

1 minute ago, Suedocode said:

Is there a place to view that online, or do I need to wait to go home and pick through the KSP directory to find it?

Not online anywhere I'm aware of, sorry. It's in the root of the KSP directory when you get a chance to look.
